message.body: Hey
Hello
How's your day going?
How r u
Where you from?
It's winding down- yours?
New York. You?
I'm in Philly.
My day has been so-so.
Got a unexpected day off so I've just been lounging.
So your in college?
Ha. No, I work.
Are you in college in NYC?
Oh cool where?
Yes. I'm a senior with an unknown major- oh the joy
I'm a courier for a company called Time Cycle.
What exactly do you do?
College in nyc seems like it'd be hella expensive.
I've spent lots of time in NYC. What part do you live in?
A courier picks up packages (or whatever really) from anywhere and just delivers them wherever they need to go. ...but fast!
You don't know any messengers in New York huh?
Well I live here so instate fees are half off. I live in Brooklyn
Fed ex and ups workers
Well I suppose they do have a similar job description but its not really like that at all.
Have you ever heard of bike messengers? New York has more than pretty much any other city.
Yes. I have
Ok. That's what I do. Not always on a bike but yeah, that's my job.
Ok. Ok. Why that job?
(1/2) Welp, let's see... You have to be a lil crazy, but its not crazy difficult, it pays real good, we're mostly independent contractors so we have total
(2/2) freedom to work as much or as little as we want (can't get fired)....
....And there's a pretty large world wide community cause every big city needs us...
And that's your plan for now? It helps you get by?
Oh, and its fun. ....if you like being outside all day.
I suppose. It bought me a house and a car and.... I don't see why I wouldn't stick with it.
How old are you?
What do you do besides an undecided senior. You work at all?
26. How bout you?
I work at a nursing home. And I'm 22
Why a nursing home? Do you want to do that for a long time? ...career wise.
Bc it was a definite job. My aunt is corporate for the company. And.... Long term!!? Idk. Idk if typing all day, sitting behind a desk is for me.
I feel ya there.
I'm not sure if I could live the desk life for the rest of my working years either.
I feel like life is more than processing information. It's sharing it- putting it to use- just not for profit. But Americans love money. We are bread to need
it to survive. It's all good and dandy - until you realize life isn't so generous
And you have to work for what you want. Work hard - play harder concept.
Indeed. When you graduate you should try to get out of the states for a while if you can. ...while you still can.
Why do you say that?
(1/2) Traveling the world is the best. It's so rewarding and you get to see stuff in person you only see stuff in books or tv. It's a no brainer. Why wouldn
(2/2) 't you want to get out of America for a while and see stuff for yourself??
Before you know it you'll have a solid career and/or family and you won't have the time or opportunity to leave for months (or years even) on end.
Your right. Have you ever been out the country?
Yeah. I've been to a handful of other countries. Its the best!
Where?
(1/2) Been to Puerto Rico a few times, a bunch of cities in Canada, Mexico, all over Italy and France. Been to London, couple cities in Belgium, Amsterdam,
And drove completely around the US. It's way worth doing if you get the opportunity.
Wow. I've just been to P.R. I don't even have a passport smh- what a waste of youth
But that great! You've enjoyed your life and your living it well....
I'm trying...
What's your nationality? If you don't mind me asking.
My whole family is from Puerto Rico. I was born here tho.
Oh cool. I'm half boricua and Trinidadian.
Nice.
